intro: Urvillea biternata, commonly known as the three-part urvillea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into three distinct lobes. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Urvillea biternata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
